result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse R Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid at the rate of $40.84 per month commencing 01-01-2016 or serve 9 days jail, consecutive as penalty for failure to pay.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  To be paid inclusive of fine payment plan.

Straight Time.
Apply 5 days sentence credit.
TIME SERVED.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse R Ramirez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

THIS BOND IS IN ADDITION TO THE PREVIOUSLY SIGNED $500.00 SIGNATURE BOND.
THE DEFENDANT MAY EITHER POST THE $100.00 CASH BAIL OR $500.00 SURETY BOND COSIGNED BY HIS AUNT VIVIAN WHITEHEAD.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

THIS BOND IS IN ADDITION TO THE PREVIOUSLY SIGNED $500.00 SIGNATURE BOND.
THE DEFENDANT MAY EITHER POST THE $100.00 CASH BAIL OR $500.00 SURETY BOND COSIGNED BY HIS AUNT VIVIAN WHITEHEAD.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Jesse R Ramirez in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden advises the Court the reasons for the missed court appearance on November 2, 2015.    The Court reinstates the previously forfeited signature bond and set cash bail in the amount of $100.00 or a surety bond in the amount of $500.00 to be cosigned by the Defendant's aunt Vivian Whitehead. .  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Jorge Fragoso for Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Jesse R Ramirez did not appear.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant did not appear, case was set for 9:30, case was called at 9:5 a.m.  Based on defendant's non appearance, Court orders bail be revoked and forfieted.  Court issues capias.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Jesse R Ramirez in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge Fragoso for attorney Eryn M Menden.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bail addressed. Defense advises the Defendant needs to enroll in AODA. Court orders warrant quashed. Court orders signature bond reinstated with the same conditions. Court will give another date.  Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Jesse R Ramirez did not appear 11:31 a.m..    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has no indication of their clients whereabouts. Court revokes and forfeits bail and issues a capias - Br. 9 only.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Jesse R Ramirez in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Defendant Jesse R Ramirez not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
